oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Blue Print showing Civil Defense sectors of Old Hickory
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This blue-print shows the Civil Defense sectors of Old Hickory and surrounding communities during World War II. Old Hickory was the home of a US Army Powder Plant from 1917-1918, which was run by the DuPont Corporation. By World War II, DuPont had purchased the former Powder Works and converted the plant into making Rayon and other synthetic textiles. The blue-print shows Old Hickory, Hopewell, Rayon City, and Duptonia (now called Lakewood).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
